channel.title: Proverbs on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in Proverbs on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: Proverbs 1
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 1

1 Proverbs of Solomon Son of David, King of Israel

7 Respect for the LORD is the first thing about being wise;

8 Listen, son, to your father’s instruction;

10 Son, if sinners tempt you, don’t give in to them.

11 If they say, “Come on,

12 Let’s swallow them alive and whole like Sheol,

13 We’ll get precious wealth

14 Throw in your lot with us,

item.title: Proverbs 2
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 2

1 Son, if you accept what I say

6 The LORD gives wisdom;

7 He stores up wisdom for godly people

9 Then you’ll understand goodness and justice,

10 Wisdom will come into your heart,

11 Discretion will come to you;

19 No man that enters her house ever comes back;

20 Follow the road good people take;

22 But sinners will be removed from the land;

item.title: Proverbs 3
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 3

1 Son, don’t forget what I’ve taught you;

3 Don’t let kindness and truth slip away from you;

4 That way you’ll find blessing

5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart;

6 Acknowledge him in everything you do,

7 Don’t get the idea that you’re smart;

8 It will heal your body and refresh your very bones.

9 Honor the LORD with your substance,

10 Your barns will be full;

item.title: Proverbs 4
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 4

1 Listen to my instruction, children;

2 I’ll give you helpful guidance;

3 When I was my father’s son,

5 Gain wisdom! Get insight!

6 Keep it with you, and it’ll protect you;

7 This is the main thing about wisdom: get it;

8 Value it highly, and it’ll elevate you;

9 It will put a beautiful wreath on your head

10 Accept what I’m telling you, son,

item.title: Proverbs 5
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 5

1 Pay attention to my wisdom, son;

3 An immoral woman’s lips drip honey;

5 Her feet go down to death;

6 She doesn’t ponder the path of life;

7 Listen to me, sons;

8 Stay away from her;

13 I didn’t listen to my teachers

14 I’ve come to the point of total ruin

15 Drink water from your own cistern,

16 Should your spring be spilled

item.title: Proverbs 6
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 6

1 Son, if you sign for your neighbor

4 Don’t sleep or slumber;

6 Go observe ants, lazy guy;

7 Though they don’t have a chief, an officer, or ruler,

9 How long will you lie around?

12 A worthless, wicked man is one

15 Tragedy will come crashing down on him;

16 Six things the LORD despises;

20 Son, keep your father’s commands;

21 Bind them next to your heart;

item.title: Proverbs 7
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 7

1 Take my advice, son;

2 Keep my commands so you can have a life;

3 Tie them on your fingers;

4 Call wisdom your sister and insight your friend,

6 At the window of my house

8 He was going down the street near her corner

11 She’s loud and rebellious, not content to stay homeâ€”

13 She grabs him and kisses him,

15 So I’ve come out to meet you,

item.title: Proverbs 8
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 8

1 Wisdom calls out,

2 It takes its stand on high places

3 It shouts at the city gates:

5 Learn prudence, simple ones;

6 Listen, so I can tell you nobler things,

7 I tell the truth

8 Everything I say is good;

9 What I say makes sense to anyone that has insight;

10 Take instruction rather than silver;

13 Respecting the LORD means hating sin,

item.title: Proverbs 9
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 9

1 Wisdom has built her house;

2 She’s done her butchering, mixed her wine,

3 She’s sent her maids

6 Abandon your foolish ways and start having a life;

7 If you correct a scoffer, you’ll be abused;

8 So don’t bother reproving scoffers; they’ll hate you;

9 Instruct the wise, and they’ll be wiser still;

10 Respect for the LORD is basic to wisdom;

11 It’ll multiply your days

item.title: Proverbs 10
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 10

1 Proverbs of Solomon

2 Ill-gotten gain doesn’t gain you anything,

3 The LORD won’t let good people go hungry;

4 A lazy hand makes for poverty;

5 They who gather crops in the summer are smart;

6 Blessings come to the good,

7 Good people leave blessed memories behind,

8 The wise in heart accept commands,

9 If you live with integrity, you’ll live with confidence;

item.title: Proverbs 11
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 11

1 The LORD detests a false balance;

2 Dishonor follows pride,

3 The integrity of the wise gives them direction;

4 Wealth won’t help you when judgment comes,

5 Goodness smooths the way for the blameless,

6 Their goodness delivers the godly;

7 When sinners die, their aspirations die as well;

8 Good people leave trouble behind,

9 The godless destroy their neighbors with their mouths,

10 A city celebrates when things go well for the godly;

item.title: Proverbs 12
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 12

1 Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge;

2 The LORD gives grace to the good,

3 Sinfulness brings instability,

4 A good wife is her husband’s crown,

5 You can trust the thinking of the righteous,

6 The words of sinners are like a murderous ambush,

7 The sinful are overthrown and disappear,

8 People are commended for using good sense;

9 The humble who work as servants are better off

item.title: Proverbs 13
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 13

1 Wise children accept their father’s discipline,

2 From the influence of your words,

3 Be careful what you say, and you’ll save yourself;

4 Lazy people want but don’t get;

5 Good people hate lies,

6 Goodness protects the blameless;

7 One person acts rich but is poor;

8 The rich can pay a ransom to save their lives,

9 The light of the godly shines bright,

item.title: Proverbs 14
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 14

1 A wise woman builds up her home;

2 We show respect for the LORD by pursuing godliness;

3 The tongues of fools become a rod for their back;

4 A manger stays clean where there are no oxen,

5 A truthful witness tells no lies;

6 Scoffers look for wisdom but don’t find it;

7 Stay away from foolish people;

8 Prudent people know where they’re going,

item.title: Proverbs 15
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 15

1 A gentle answer deflects anger;

2 The wise dispense knowledge;

3 The LORD sees everything;

4 Gentle words are a tree of life,

5 Fools reject their father’s discipline,

6 There’s wealth in the house of the godly,

7 The lips of the wise give good advice;

8 The LORD detests the sacrifices of sinners,

9 He detests the way of the wicked,

10 Those who abandon the way incur harsh discipline;

item.title: Proverbs 16
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 16

1 We have intentions,

2 Our ways may seem pure to us,

3 Commit your work to the LORD,

4 The LORD has a purpose for everything,

5 The LORD detests arrogant people

6 Loyalty and faithfulness atone for sin;

7 When we please the LORD,

8 A little with goodness is better

9 You can make your plans,

10 A king needs to make inspired decisions;

item.title: Proverbs 17
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 17

1 A dry morsel eaten in peace tastes better

2 A wise servant will rule a shameful son

3 Fire refines silver and a furnace purifies gold,

4 Wrongdoers pay attention to gossip;

5 People that mock the poor insult their Maker;

6 Grandchildren are the crown of old age;

7 Fine speech doesn’t fit with being a fool;

8 A bribe is a lucky charm in its owner’s sight;

item.title: Proverbs 18
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 18

1 Unfriendly people pursue selfish ends;

2 Fools don’t delight in learning,

3 When sinners come, contempt comes with them;

4 Wise thoughts are deep water;

5 Don’t cater to bad people

6 Fools’ lips instigate conflict;

7 The mouths of fools bring about their ruin;

8 Rumors are like delicious morsels;

9 People that aren’t productive

10 The LORD’s name is a strong tower;

11 The wealth of the rich is their fortified city;

item.title: Proverbs 19
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 19

1 The honest poor are better off

2 It’s not good to not know;

3 When people’s foolishness brings them to ruin,

4 Wealth draws lots of friends

5 False witnesses will get their just due;

6 Many ask for generous people’s blessing;

7 Relatives of the poor despise them,

8 People that gain wisdom care about themselves;

9 False witnesses won’t go unpunished;

10 Living in luxury isn’t fitting for a fool,

item.title: Proverbs 20
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 20

1 Wine is a mocker, beer is a brawler;

2 A king’s anger is like a lion’s growl;

3 Staying away from conflict honors you;

4 Anyone too lazy to plow

5 A purpose in your heart is like deep water,

6 Many claim to be loyal,

7 How blessed the children are

8 A king on a just throne

9 Who can say, “I’ve cleansed my heart;

item.title: Proverbs 21
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 21

1 A king’s heart in the LORD’s hand

2 Your own way seems right to you,

3 The LORD wants goodness and justice

4 Arrogant eyes and a proud heart

5 Diligent planning gives you an advantage;

6 Getting rich by lying is a dissipating vapor

7 Sinful people’s violence sweeps them away

8 A guilty person’s road is full of curves,

9 It’s better to live in the corner of a housetop

item.title: Proverbs 22
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 22

1 A good name means more than great wealth;

2 The rich and the poor have this in common:

3 Prudent people see evil and avoid it;

4 Wealth, honor, and life are rewards

5 Briers and snares lie along the path of perverse people;

6 Train up children in the way they should go;

7 The rich rule the poor;

8 Those who sow sin reap disaster,

item.title: Proverbs 23
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 23

1 When you’re dining with a ruler,

2 Put a knife to your throat

3 Don’t crave very many of his delicacies;

4 Don’t wear yourself out trying to get wealthy;

5 When you stare at wealth, it disappears;

6 Don’t eat with stingy people

8 You’ll vomit the morsel you’ve eaten

9 Don’t speak where fools can hear you;

10 Don’t move an ancient boundary marker

item.title: Proverbs 24
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 24

1 Don’t envy bad people

3 Wisdom builds a house;

5 The wise are strong;

7 Wisdom is out of the reach of fools;

8 People call them schemers who plot misfortune;

10 If adversity makes you weak,

11 Rescue those unjustly sentenced to death;

12 If you try to excuse yourself by claiming ignorance,

13 Son, eat honey; it’s good;

14 Understand that wisdom is like that to your soul;

item.title: Proverbs 25
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 25

2 It’s God’s privilege not to reveal things

3 A king’s mind is as unsearchable

4 Remove the dross from silver,

5 Keep corrupt advisors away from a king,

6 Don’t claim a privileged position in a king’s presence

7 It’s better to be told to come up higher

9 When you’re arguing with your neighbor,

11 Words fitly spoken in the proper place

12 A wise correction to an attentive ear

item.title: Proverbs 26
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 26

1 Like snow in summer and rain at harvest,

2 Like a flitting sparrow, like a fluttering swallow,

3 A whip is for a horse,

4 Don’t answer fools’ arguments;

5 Answer fools’ arguments;

6 Trusting a fool to deliver a message

7 A proverb in the mouth of a fool

8 Honoring a fool

9 A proverb in the mouth of a fool

10 Whoever hires a fool or passerby

item.title: Proverbs 27
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 27

1 Don’t brag about tomorrow;

2 Let somebody else praise you, not your own mouth;

3 A rock is heavy and sand weighs a lot,

4 Anger and wrath are bad enough,

5 Open rebuke is better than secret love.

6 A friend’s wounds may be sincere,

7 A person that’s full hates honey;

8 If you wander away from home,

9 Oil and perfume make you feel good,

item.title: Proverbs 28
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 28

1 Sinners run when no one’s chasing,

2 When a country sins, lots of leaders vie for control;

3 The poor that oppress the poor

4 Those who leave the Law commend the sinful,

5 Bad people don’t understand justice,

6 Being poor and honest

7 Young people that keep the Law are wise offspring,

8 Whoever increases wealth by charging high interest,

9 When people quit listening to the Law,

item.title: Proverbs 29
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 29

1 If you stiffen your neck after repeated correction,

2 When good people rule, people are happy;

3 A son that loves wisdom makes his father happy,

4 A good king creates a stable country,

5 Flattering your friends

6 Bad people’s sins become their downfall,

7 The godly care about the rights of the poor;

8 Scoffers can set a city in an uproar,

9 When the wise argue with the foolish,

item.title: Proverbs 30
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 30

1 The Words of Agur Son of Jakeh, an Oracle

2 Surely I’m too stupid to be human;

3 I haven’t mastered wisdom;

4 Who but God goes up to the sky and back down

5 Every message from God proves true;

6 Don’t add to what he says;

7 I ask you for two things before I die:

10 Don’t slander a slave to his master,

item.title: Proverbs 31
item.description:
Proverbs Chapter 31

1 The Words of King Lemuel

2 Please listen, son,

4 Lemuel, it’s not for kings to guzzle wine

6 Give alcohol to the dying

8 Speak up for those who can’t speak for themselves;

10 Who can find a capable wife of noble character?

11 Her husband can rely on her,

12 She’ll do him good her whole life.

13 She looks for wool and linen,
